reviews.text: This quality design hotel is extremely good value. Everything is well designed for functionality and appearance, it is brand new, we liked the Nespresso coffee machine and capsules in room, comfy beds, we had joining rooms for kids, large flat screen TV, great shower etc.
reviews.title: Good value design hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Make sure you book "Prestige" not the other one. It is out of town in industrial area (we have a car so no problem) which is probably why the price is so good given the quality.
reviews.title: LSD meets the Seventeen Century

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All you need to know is that this hotel is a bed factory, but an exceedingly well run and satisfactory one at that, worth its 3 star rating and offering exceptional value for money.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location
Beautiful Hotel
reviews.text: However, for more flavour and a further explanation, read on.....

reviews.text: As indicated, it is 3 star, other Roi Soleil hotels without the Prestige name are two star.
reviews.title: so friendly, so neat!

reviews.text: Staying in the Prestige for the second time Great hotel , good price .The room very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: "cosy" Breakfast is a "Sunday brunch "We do recommend this hotel , the best in Colmar.
reviews.title: Very Good, reasonably priced hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of course you need a car there is so much to see around Alsace is Great
reviews.title: Beautiful new hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights in September. Initially we tried to book an hotel in Colmar itself but everything we fancied was fully booked. Came across this one via Trip Advisor and we weren't disappointed. It's a new hotel so hasn't had the chance to get knocked about. The decor is very modern and a bit "quirky". Our room wasn't the biggest in the world and no view to speak of but perfectly adequate for us and our luggage. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet. Free WiFi worked great in the room. Parking was free too and plenty of it. I agree with some other reviewers that you need a car if you are going to stay here as it's too far out of town and we were quoted about 30Euros each way for a taxi, we took the car instead! The location is on a main road and next to retail outlets etc., very much like you find driving through America or where you find Premier Inns here in the UK, i.e. next to businesses etc. No problems communicating in English with Reception. Downside was the bar, as there was only 1 Receptionist who was trying to book in guests and service the bar at the same time and of course those booking in got priority. Breakfast buffet was good, although if you like "real" coffee you will be disappointed as theirs is out of one of those multi-choice machines. P.S. Don't miss the mini Statue Of Liberty on the main road near the hotel which is an exact smaller version of the "Lady" herself.
reviews.title: Great hotel good prices!

reviews.text: We stayed at Roi Soleil for one night in September. This is a very nice, well appointed, new hotel. It is located is off the main road and has an unusual entry. Parking is available for no extra cost which is a real plus for us when traveling in Europe. The breakfast buffet was wonderful. We would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Passepartout
just great
reviews.text: Great hotel, great breakfast, nice people

reviews.title: Good room and food
reviews.text: Rooms are small but very nice and clean, great beds

reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location, excellent breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel, looks brand new. The location is good for an overnight stopover but is a wee bit too far out for sightseeing Colmar.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, bit too far out though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very attentive and helpful, The room was large and had all you would need, The bed was comfortable and bathroom had a good shower.
reviews.title: A comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar area is quite small, the breakfast area is large and the buffet is good. we would have enjoyed staying longer but the location would have meant travelling by car a lot. there is a steak house next door but we didn't use it.
reviews.title: 3 Stars? Really?

reviews.text: Perfect for roaming the region and visit Colmar and Strasbourg. Costly atmosphere, above-standard rooms, de luxe bathrooms, excellent breakfast. Dismal views over commercial warehouses. But, so what? You only sleep (well) on the premises after all.
reviews.title: Don't stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel and travelled to Europa Park (about 50 mins away), nearby Strasbourg, Zurich and Baden-Baden airport (about 1 hour 50).
reviews.title: Great Breakfast and Room
